name: shoddiness
content:
shoddiness noun [U]
(POOR QUALITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being badly and carelessly made, using low quality materials: Chronic underfunding, lack of repairs, and shoddiness made accidents inevitable. A stroll around the city will reveal at once the shabbiness and shoddiness of its housing.
More examplesFewer examplesParents and politicians had warned about the shoddiness of many school buses. Nervous about the shoddiness of the main school building, he scraped together $58,000 to renovate it.It's not the unhealthiness of the food that's putting us off, but its downright shoddiness. Some reviewers speculate that the shoddiness is a result of the book being published before it was ready.
